lead_paragraph: A measure supporting gay rights in Eureka Springs is on a May 12 ballot, and opponents say the effort to promote the town as gay-friendly has hurt a nearby Christian destination.

headline.print_headline: Two Faces of Tourism Are Clashing in Arkansas
headline.main: In Arkansas, Gay Rights Ordinance Highlights Clash Between Two Faces of Tourism

snippet: A measure supporting gay rights in Eureka Springs is on a May 12 ballot, and opponents say the effort to promote the town as gay-friendly has hurt a nearby Christian destination.
abstract: Ordinance passed in Eurkea Springs, Ark, that seeks to protect gay people and others against discrimination has led to divisive debate over city's identity as holiday destination for both conservative Christians and gays; town annually puts on Passion Play, which draws thousands of devout visitors, but it also has been promoted as 'Gay Capital of the Ozarks' due to creation of domestic partner registry in 2007 and because it has long welcomed gays.
